alert.note: Alert for Yosemite NP outside of the valley; Yosemite Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 14 at 9:51AM PDT until May 19 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Pohono Bridge affecting Yosemite NP through the valley and Yosemite Valley zones. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Merced River at Pohono Bridge. * WHEN...From this evening to Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Western portion of North Pines Campground located at the east end of Yosemite Valley between the confluence of the Merced River and Tenaya Creek begins to flood. Water rises to the base of the swinging bridge downstream from Chapel Meadow. At 12.5 feet, Northside Drive and Southside Drive, which are the main roads in Yosemite Valley, become flooded and are closed to traffic. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM PDT Sunday the stage was 9.2 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be briefly reached early Monday morning and then again overnight Monday night based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Location Fld Observed Forecasts (10 am PDT) -------- Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Merced River Pohono Bridge 10.0 9.2 Sun 8 AM PDT 9.6 10.2 11.1 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning by 10 AM PDT.

area.areaDesc: Yosemite NP outside of the valley; Yosemite Valley
